intro: Cypella laxa, commonly known as the slender cypella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, aromatic scent. Cypella laxa is a low-growing perennial that thrives in well-drained conditions and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
